bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Tery. holding terms at Tacoma, in and for Pierce County
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx In the matter of application of x x M.A. WALKER, x WRIT of HABEAS CORPUS. x for a Writ of Habeas Corpus x xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
To LEWIS BYRD, Sheriff of Pierce County, greeting:--

We command you, that you have the body of M.A. WALKER, by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time we cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said M.A. Walker, shall be called or charged, before Hon. JOHN P. HOYT, Judge of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of the Territory of Washington, at the Court-room of said Court, at Tacoma, on the day of August, 1885, at oclock, , m., of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there in considered concerning the said M.A. WALKER,
And have you then and there this writ.
Witness the HON. JOHN P. HOYT, Judge of the said District Court, at the Court room there-of in the City of Tacoma, Pierce County, Wash. Terry. this day of August, 1885.
